metadata.longDescription: Hailing from Karnataka and South India, Shenga Chutney is a creamy, nutty delight. Made from roasted peanuts ground with garlic, red chilies, and tamarind, this chutney offers a perfect balance of spice and tang. Rich in protein and heart-healthy fats, it's an excellent accompaniment to dosa, idli, or steamed rice.

A staple in Karnataka and Maharashtra, Putani Chutney showcases the earthy flavors of roasted gram. Blended with coconut and tempered with mustard seeds and curry leaves, it offers a smooth texture with a delightful crunch. High in protein and fiber, it's a nutritious addition to your meal.

A rural favorite in central and southern India, Gurullu Chutney offers a deep, nutty flavor with a hint of bitterness. Packed with essential fatty acids and minerals, it's not just tasty but also beneficial for skin and heart health.

Originating from Karnataka and Maharashtra, Agasi Chutney is a powerhouse of nutrition. Made from roasted flaxseeds, it's rich in omega-3 fatty acids and lignans. Its nutty, slightly spicy flavor profile makes it a perfect companion for chapati or mixed with rice.
